value: Landscape with a Cottage and a Large Tree

label: Description
value: A cottage with a large tree extending beyond the plate, left. A canal in front of the house and to the right. Windmill in distance.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Windmill in foreground, left, with a ramshackle cottage beyond it.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two Deaths on horseback, others on foot in action. Two volumns of vines in the bottom margin.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
The Big Boom (Peasants Under a Vine-Trellis)

label: Description
value: An outdoor scene in front of a tavern at left. Under a vine-trellis before the tavern are two seated peasants at right. Left, a standing woman pouring wine into a glass. Behind her stands a child in the open doorway.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Grand volumns of the Corinthian order at left. In front, the Virgin and Joseph sit with the Child standing by their knees. The three Kings offer their gifts with their entourage behind them. Mountains in the background, the Star above surrounded by putti.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Triumph of Caesar: The Corselet Bearers

label: Description
value: A triumphal procession of Roman soldiers carrying trophies. The spoils, including armor, furniture, drinking vessels, and other objects made of precious metals are loaded onto stretchers, pole, and spears. The figures are depicted walking left-to-right, as on Roman and Greek architectural reliefs.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The full-length figure of the bearded Saint, standing, turned toward the right, his head facing left. He holds an open book on his left arm, his right hand pointing to a passage. A sword lies on the ground at his feet. A view of the sea in the background. The artist's monogram and date, "1514", appears lower right on the wall behind the figure.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A mountain landscape with a narrow road on right. On the road are two men on horseback and three men walking. In mid-distance, right and left, and in background, trees. In left foreground, two men seated with their backs turned toward spectator. Inscribed, lower right: "Herman van Swaneuelt in fec. et ex. cum pr. Re."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A landscape with buildings and ruins starting at right mid-distance and leading towards left background. In mid-distance a woman with a parasol and accompanied by three persons walking toward the houses. In foreground, a shepherd with sheep; at left, part of a wall visible. Trees in background. Inscribed, lower left: "Herman van Swanevelt inventor fecit."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In mid-foreground an old man standing in frontal position looking to right. He is seen up to his knees. At left, a dog; at right, a boy looking to left and holding a mouse-trap on a pole. Inscribed, upper right: "C. Visscher inv. et sculp. exec 1655."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Saint Matthew is presented in three-quarter view seated at a desk writing his gospel. In his right hand he holds a quill and his left hand rests on an open book. He is accompanied by his attribute, a young angel who appears at left, just behind the Saint's shoulder.

label: Notes
value: Saint Matthew is presented in three-quarter view seated at a desk writing his gospel. In his right hand he holds a quill and his left hand rests on an open book. He is accompanied by his attribute, a young angel who appears at left, just behind the Saint's shoulder.

label: Description
value: St. Mark is presented seated at a table on which his pen, ink pot, book and papers are placed. He holds his hand to his chest and looks toward the right. He is accompanied by his attribute, the lion who appears at left, just behind the Saint's shoulder.

label: Description
value: St. Luke sits at a table writing his gospel in a book. He writes with a quill pen in his right hand and holds the book open with his left. He is accompanied by his attribute, the ox which appears just behind the Saint's shoulder at right.  Behind him, at left, a painting is shown on an easel, a reference to the legend that Saint Luke was an artist and that he painted the first portrait of the Virgin.

label: Notes
value: St. Luke sits at a table writing his gospel in a book. He writes with a quill pen in his right hand and holds the book open with his left. He is accompanied by his attribute, the ox which appears just behind the Saint's shoulder at right. Behind him, at left, a painting is shown on an easel, a reference to the legend that Saint Luke was an artist and that he painted the first portrait of the Virgin.

label: Description
value: St. John stands, head turned to the left, looking upward. Behind him to the left a landscape suggests that the Saint is on the Island of Patmos.  In his right hand he holds his pen poised to write the apocryphal Book of Revelations, which he holds in his left hand. Behind him, at right, flies his attribute, the eagle that carries the ink pot in his beak and protects the Saint with his outstretched wing.

label: Notes
value: St. John stands, head turned to the left, looking upward. Behind him to the left a landscape suggests that the Saint is on the Island of Patmos. In his right hand he holds his pen poised to write the apocryphal Book of Revelations, which he holds in his left hand. Behind him, at right, flies his attribute, the eagle that carries the ink pot in his beak and protects the Saint with his outstretched wing.
Old Woman and a Boy with Candles

label: Description
value: Half-figures of a woman and a boy by candlelight. The woman, turned to right, looking down on a burning candle in her right hand. A boy, left, takes light for his candle from hers. Inscribed, lower left: "Peter Paul Rubens inuenit"; center: Quis vetot apposite, lumen de lumine tolli./Mille licet capiant, deperit inde nihil."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two goats in middle foreground. One, at right, lying in frontal view; the other goat, left, standing, with his back towards the spectator. No inscriptions.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Two Goats, from Berchem's "Animalia" (Animals) [ Animalia ad vivum delineata et aqua forti aeri impressa Studio et Arte Nicolai Berchem]

label: Description
value: In froeground, a young goat standing in side view, toward right. His head in frontal position. At left, another goat lying in side view facing left. No inscriptions.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of the Marquis de Longveil

label: Description
value: A portrait in an oval frame, in which is written, "Mes.re Rene de Longveil, Marquis de Maisons Ministre de Stat et President au Parlem." The Marquis is turned slihtly to the left, with his head facing frontally. Below, left, the artist's name and the date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
The Country Woman and the Sumpter Crossing a Brook

label: Description
value: A landscape with a brook in foreground, trees in background. At right, a sumpter drinks from the brook; at left, a woman with her head turned to right stands nearby. A dog jumps in front of her. Inscribed, upper left corner: "K. du Jardin fecit"; lower right: "27."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
The Thatched Cottage on the Hill

label: Description
value: Landscape with trees at left; a river in right foreground. A thatched cottage visible at left; another cottage over the river at right. In mid-distance, a church; clouds and three birds in the sky. Inscribed: left center: "Ruisdael."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
The Dance In Front of An Inn

label: Description
value: In front of an old house, at left, a couple are dancing. A musician who plays a clarinet, stands behind them. Several onlookers surround them in semi-circle. Houses in background with a group of peasants standing in front of one of them. Inscribed, lower margin: "Nu is't de reghte tydt... kekmisis"; lower left: "Joan de Vischer fecit"; lower center: "Ad. van Ostade pinxit"; lower right: "Nicolaus Visscher execudit".

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Three-quarter length portrait of the architect, seated, turned slightly to the right, facing the spectator. His left hand is gloved and holds the glove for his right hand. Title and arms below, followed by publisher's address. Signed in plate below frame: "Edelinck Egues Sculpsit."
Prà della Valle (Prato della Valle, Padua), from the Vedute altre prese da i luoghi altre ideate

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
A View of a Town with a Bishop's Tomb

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Cardinal Jaques Benigne Bossuet (1627-1704)

label: Description
value: Full-length portrait of the prelate, standing, facing the spectator, his head turned toward the left. His right hand rests on a book, his left holds his hat. He wears the robes of his office. Title and arms in margin below. Signed and dated below frame, lower right.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Three-quarter length portrait of the prelate, seated, turned toward the right, looking out at the spectator. He wears the robes of his office. Title and arms in margin below. Signed and dated in frame, lower right.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The saint is shown full-length, facing the spectator, his figure turned slightly to the right. He is bound to the column, his hands tied behind his back. Four arrows have pierced his body. The monogram of the artist appears on a paper which is attached to a stone shaft, lower left.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A half-length portrait of a warrior in frontal view; the body turned slightly to right, head to left. The warrior has a short beard; he wears a cap with a fur border with a pin attached in front and a feather in back. Inscribed, right center: "Schmidt fec."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
